comments.text: Bonm lugar para pegar carona a juiz de fora ou BH. Demorou 10 minutos ou menos

I followed this instructions on november 2013 and got a ride to Juiz de Fora in less than 10 minutes. Got off the bus just after the Fragoso toll, and walked some meters until I found a good spot next to the road. Really easy.
It's easy to get there. The ticket costs 6 R. Lees than 40 min I was there trying.

HOW TO GET HERE:
take a bus from Central do Brasil (Rio de Janeiro) to Vila Cana√£ (border of Duque de Caxias), and ask to get off it in the toll.
there\\'s a Federal Police next to that toll (the cars go too fast there, anyway i got a ride in less than 20minutes. maybe it\\'ll be easier to you if you take a bus to Petr√≥polis and start hitchhiking from there. but the bus is like 10reais more expensive -not too much, but you can drink like 3 bottles of beer with the difference hahah-)

Ped√°gio Vi√∫va Gra√ßa (toll plaza). Good spot for hitching to S√£o Paulo. You can get here by bus 193C from the bus terminal next to Central Station (metro Central). Starts from platform D, spot no. 07. Hitch slightly further away from toll booths, there is a bus stop to pull over, restaurant and supermarket.
I did take a bus to the EETEPA ( university just across) and  hitchhiked from there. Really easy, most car go to Alter do Chao
Great spot at the gas station, there is signal and you are at the intersection of two roads from where people might go to the east. A 4x4 took us in the back of his car to Jijoca de Jericoacoara.
Perfect spot to go to the north west. There is a gas station on the other side of the road, and a lot of space for trucks to stop.
Plenty of space right after rond point

Perfect spot, near the exit of Matinhos and accessible with the free city bus. In twenty minutes, we had one offer to take us for 80 R$, but we waited a bit more and received a valid hitch all the way to Curitiba! üëå

Next to gas station 
Plenty of food and internet
Long walk to get to this optimum spotNext to posto and lanchonette and place for car to stop
so hard to hitchhike in Brazil but as soon as you start talking to Guayanese folk it was easy enough guayanese in the gas station I marked heading to lethem that we had an easy time getting a ride
A car stopped as soon as we started to hitchike! He took us to a beach to surf, and then to S√£o Paulo.
We first tried to hitchike on the roundabout, but cars had little visibility to see where to stop. It's much better after the bridge when it's a long straight road ahead.
Lots of traffic, and space for cars to stop. Accessible by the city bus 388 from the center of Rio for 5 R$. Our host invited us to do jet ski!!

√ìtimo pra S√£o Paulo. Infelizmente eu queria ir pra o Rio de Janeiro. Muitos camioneros pararam pra ofrecer carona ao S√£o Paulo.
Pra o Rio peguei o √¥nibus e foi pra a 040 mais no sul.

Eu estava precisando de uma carona da praia do rosa para Florian√≥polis. Nesta curva os carros que passam todos v√£o em dire√ß√£o a cidade que eu precisava e passam bem devagar pois √© uma curva fechada. Tem um bom acostamento para poderem parar e te dar a carona.

Easy to get to Lancois
12 km to Lencois from there.

We were hitchhiking at the end of the gas station. A car going out of the car station took us directly to Curitiba, but I believe the cars on the rodovia have enough space to stop. The gas station is accessible with the bus 032 from the m√©tro station "Vila Sonia".
Posto Fase Quatro with Shell petrol station. You can get here by bus 164 from Terminal Tiet√™ or from Metro Cidade Jardim, as well as bus 282 from Tiet√™ or Metro Butanta.
Easy to get a ride  to Dianopolis
Roundabout for rides direction Palmas.Dian√≥polis
Quite easy to get a ride but make sure you go at least to Chapada da Datividade or you‚Äôll get stuck in between cities for a while ;)
There is a speed bump by the gas station  perfect to hitchhike, I found a truck driver all the way to Palmeiras ( Bahia)
Got a ride in 5 min. I was asking people directly at the gas station and got a ride to Maraba
Was hitchhiking with a sign on the road outside of the gas station ( no much traffic at the gas station) and a car drove me alll the way to Altamira ( Para)

Depoia de tentar por mais de tr√™s horas debaixo das mangueiras da rotat√≥ria anterior, aqui encontrei minha sorte. Uma direra pra BH, comecei a pegar gosta pela Adrnalina, ainda mais depois que come√ßamos a entrar na metropolitana. Nunca tinha visto uma metropolitana t√£o industrial, tensa e intensa na minha vida. Com tantos morros e desmorros.

Minha primeira carona notrna, indo pra Araguari a partir de Gyn, Aqui deveria ter um quebra-molas e ou um sensor de velocidade.  Tentei depois da rotat√≥ria e n√£o foi muito bom, na sa√≠da do posto JK tamb√©m √© poss√≠vel. Mas se ainda houver um dos dois reguladores de velocidade ser√° bem melhor.  Aqui usei uma plaquinha. We got there by taxi with the app "Ubiz car Brazil" for 16R$. There are not so many cars but they all go in the right direction and don't go that fast. There is no signal but "bar do lim√£o" might have Wi-Fi.

Trucks are coming out of the quarry regularly. There is a restaurant, Wi-Fi, and a bathroom. The vehicles on the road pass by fast, but you can ask the truck drivers going out of the quarry. Beware of the sun!

We wanted to go to Foz do Igua√ßu so it may have been better to hitch at the exit of Guarapuava instead of the entrance. The spot near the roundabout is great because it's after a speed bump on the highway. You can signal to the drivers on the highway, and those who exit the gas station. There is enough space for cars and truck to park for a few minutes.

We got a ride from a truck driver to Foz do Igua√ßu! üöö
We talked with truck drivers while looking for a cardboard. One of them proposed to take us to Guaratuba!
Accessible by bus J62 from Curitiba, a lot of truck drivers stop there as it's the first gas station after Curitiba.
Bus stop to shelter from rain or sun
Perfect spot, place to stop and car have to slow down but very few traffic

Lots of bumper to slow down cars
A motorcycle took me for a long ride 
Happy I‚Äôm still alive

State border office
Car have to slow down
Bathrooms available
Posto 24 horas para pernoitar caso n√£o consiga carona, por√©m com muitos caminhoneiros que param aqui
Easy to get a ride to Porto National with a sign ( 5min )

I was Hitchiking with a sign outside  of the gas station , on the road directly because  there is almost no traffic at the gas station. Got picked up by aa Truckdriver who was  going to Mina Girais but jumped out at Oliveira de Fatima because  was going  to Bahia

Although there is a good place for cars to park and cars go slow throw here, this spot is not so good, because there is no gas station here and according to my experience in Brasil, is pretty hard hitchhiking on the road. However I was lucky and I got a car that took me to Sao Domingo, where there is a direct road to the south.
Antigamente por aqui depois ou antes deste microviaduto tinha um quebra-molas. Num sei hoje.

Peguei logo depois do posto, mas acredito que ap√≥s o cruzamento da Go 020 com Br 352 seja bem melhor. Indo de Gyn at√© Araguari.

Terceira carona da vida.  Indo de Gyn at√© Araguari. Peguei o Bus 582, O bus 580 por Hidrol√¢ndia tamb√©m √© um caminho poss√≠vel como tentaria em outra oportunidade. 

Acredito que o posto adiante depois do trevo da GO 219 deva ser bem melhor, mas minha inexperi√™ncia me levou por aqui e funcionou.

Seguda carona da vida. N√£o do melhor lugar, mas deu certo. Fui deixado nas proximidades e fui tentando, at√© chegar embaixo de um destas passarelas e conseguir com um pequeno caminh√£o. O melhor lugar s√£o os quebramo-las poucos kms antes. Direto pra Goi√¢nia.

We got there by Uber. It's quite empty but the trucks have a lot of time to see you and space to stop. We found a ride with Rodrigo who took us all the way to Cuiab√°. Good luck!
Got my ride further on the road but this a the best spot, car have to slow down and many space to stop

Got exited and walked to the junction.
Maybe works better closer to town when slower !
Was raining so stayed under the roof of these picnic tables
Most of the car at the gas station are not leaving town
Good visibility for cars, but many people told us that it would be easier to go to Angra dos Reis with the city bus that comes every 30 mins. We were lucky enough to catch a ride to Paraty üòÑ
Lots of trucks. I didnt speak portuguese so communication was harder. Took a car with two drivers that didnt speak english. Fun people
